required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Plasma, Urine and Tear Omics Changes in Different Diets
clinical_study.official_title: Plasma, Urine and Tear Omics Changes Based on Protein and Metabonomics Technology in Different Diets and Screening of Healthy Diet Markers

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: The study plans to start in July 2021, and it is expected that 20 healthy people (aged 18-70 years old, BMI 18.5-40kg/m2) will carry out a 5-week intervention and follow-up. Participants will be enrolled in the group through the screening and plan to take regular diet, OGTT, high-fat diet, low-calorie diet and ketogenic diet within 5 weeks. The proteomics and metabolomics indicators of tear, plasma, and urine specimens will be measured at 5 time points at baseline, 30 minutes, 1 hour, 2 hours, and 3 hours for each diet. The correlation of proteomics and metabolomics indicators with classic laboratory parameters (BMI, HDL, LDL, cholesterol, triglyceride levels, and insulin resistance (HOMA-IR)) will be analyzed.

primary_outcome.measure: Proteomics and metabolomics changes after diet intervention
primary_outcome.description: Changes of plasma, urine, tear proteomics and metabolomics after diet intervention

intervention.description: have OGTT,normal diet, high fat diet, low calorie diet, and ketogenic diet in turn

facility.name: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University
